SELECT student.major, student.age FROM student
  LEFT JOIN has_pet ON student.stuid = has_pet.stuid
  LEFT JOIN pets ON has_pet.petid = pets.petid
  WHERE pets.pettype = "cat" AND pets.petid IS NULL
    ORDER BY student.major, student.age

SELECT major, AVG(age) AS avg_age
FROM student
LEFT JOIN has_pet ON student.stuid = has_pet.stuid
LEFT JOIN pets ON has_pet.petid = pets.petid
WHERE pets.pettype = 'cat' AND pets.petid IS NULL
GROUP BY major
ORDER BY avg_age DESC
SELECT stuid FROM student WHERE stuid NOT IN (SELECT stuid FROM has_pet WHERE petid IN (SELECT petid FROM pets WHERE pettype = "cat"))

## Solution

We need to first join the student table with the has_pet table on the student_id column, and then join the has_pet table with the pets table on the pet_id column. This will give us a list of all students who have pets, and their pet IDs. We can then use a subquery to find the IDs of the students who do not own cats as pets, by using the NOT IN operator to exclude the pet IDs that belong to cats.

Here is the final SQL query:
SELECT fname, age FROM student WHERE stuid IN (SELECT stuid FROM has_pet WHERE petid = 'dog' AND petid NOT IN (SELECT petid FROM has_pet WHERE petid = 'cat'))

SELECT fname
FROM student
WHERE stuid IN (SELECT stuid
                FROM has_pet
                WHERE petid IN (SELECT petid
                                FROM pets
                                WHERE pettype = 'dog' AND petid NOT IN (SELECT petid
                                                                            FROM pets
                                                                            WHERE pettype = 'cat')))
ORDER BY fname

SELECT pettype, weight 
FROM pets 
WHERE pet_age = (SELECT MIN(pet_age) FROM pets)
SELECT petid, weight FROM pets WHERE pet_age > 1
SELECT has_pet.petid, pets.weight FROM pets, has_pet WHERE pets.petid = has_pet.petid AND pets.pet_age > 1
SELECT pettype, AVG(pet_age), MAX(pet_age) FROM pets GROUP BY pettype

SELECT pettype, AVG(pet_age) as avg_age, MAX(pet_age) as max_age
FROM pets
GROUP BY pettype

SELECT pettype, AVG(weight) as avg_weight
FROM pets
GROUP BY pettype

SELECT p.pettype, AVG(p.weight) AS avg_weight
FROM pets p
JOIN has_pet hp ON p.petid = hp.petid
JOIN student s ON hp.stuid = s.stuid
GROUP BY p.pettype
ORDER BY avg_weight DESC

SELECT fname, age FROM student
WHERE stuid IN (SELECT stuid FROM has_pet
                WHERE petid IN (SELECT petid FROM pets
                                WHERE pettype = 'dog' AND weight > 10))
SELECT DISTINCT st.fname, st.age FROM student st JOIN has_pet hp ON st.stuid = hp.stuid JOIN pets p ON hp.petid = p.petid WHERE p.pettype = 'dog' ORDER BY st.fname

select petid from student s inner join has_pet h on s.stuid = h.stuid inner join pets p on h.petid = p.petid where lname = 'Smith'
```

WHERE lname = 'Smith'
AND stuid IN (SELECT stuid FROM has_pet
WHERE petid IN (SELECT petid FROM pets
WHERE pettype = 'dog')
)
ORDER BY petid
LIMIT 1

SELECT continents.contid, continents.continent, COUNT(countries.countryid) AS countries_count FROM continents INNER JOIN countries ON continents.contid = countries.continent GROUP BY continents.contid, continents.continent ORDER BY continents.contid ASC

FROM continents
LEFT JOIN countries ON continents.continent = countries.continent
GROUP BY continents.contid, continents.continent

FROM countries
WHERE countryid IN (SELECT countryid
                   FROM countries
                   WHERE countryname IS NOT NULL)

SELECT
    continents.continent AS continent,
    AVG(cars_data.mpg) AS avg_mpg
FROM
    continents
    LEFT JOIN countries ON continents.continent = countries.continent
    LEFT JOIN car_makers ON countries.countryid = car_makers.country
    LEFT JOIN model_list ON car_makers.id = model_list.maker
    LEFT JOIN car_names ON model_list.modelid = car_names.model
    LEFT JOIN cars_data ON car_names.makeid = cars_data.id
GROUP BY
    continents.continent

SELECT 
    c.fullname,
    c.id,
    COUNT(*) AS num_models
FROM
    car_makers c
        LEFT JOIN
    model_list m ON c.id = m.maker
GROUP BY
    c.id

SELECT car_makers.fullname, car_makers.id, COUNT(model_list.modelid) FROM car_makers
    INNER JOIN model_list ON car_makers.id = model_list.car_makers
    GROUP BY car_makers.id, car_makers.fullname

SELECT MIN(horsepower) FROM car_names WHERE makeid = (SELECT id FROM model_list WHERE maker = 'Ford' AND model = 'Fusion')
```

SELECT model FROM car_names
WHERE id IN
    (SELECT car_names.id
     FROM car_names
     JOIN cars_data ON car_names.makeid = cars_data.id
     JOIN model_list ON car_names.modelid = model_list.modelid
     JOIN car_makers ON model_list.maker = car_makers.id
     JOIN countries ON car_makers.countryid = countries.id
     JOIN continents ON countries.continentid = continents.contid
     JOIN countries ON continents.continentid = continents.contid
     WHERE horsepower = (SELECT MIN(horsepower)
                         FROM cars_data
                         WHERE id = car_names.id))

SELECT model FROM model_list
WHERE id IN (SELECT makeid FROM cars_data
            WHERE weight < (SELECT AVG(weight) FROM cars_data))
SELECT model FROM model_list WHERE modelid IN (SELECT modelid FROM car_names WHERE makeid IN (SELECT makeid FROM cars_data WHERE weight < (SELECT AVG(weight) FROM cars_data)))
SELECT car_makers.fullname FROM car_makers JOIN car_names ON car_makers.id = car_names.makeid JOIN cars_data ON car_names.model = cars_data.model WHERE cars_data.year = 1970

SELECT DISTINCT car_makers.fullname FROM car_makers
        JOIN cars_data ON car_makers.id = cars_data.makeid
        WHERE cars_data.year = 1970

SELECT cars_data.make, cars_data.year
FROM cars_data
JOIN car_names ON cars_data.makeid = car_names.makeid
JOIN model_list ON car_names.modelid = model_list.modelid
JOIN car_makers ON model_list.maker = car_makers.maker
JOIN countries ON car_makers.country = countries.countryid
JOIN continents ON countries.continent = continents.contid
WHERE year = (SELECT MIN(year) FROM cars_data)
ORDER BY year

SELECT car_makers.fullname, cars_data.year
FROM car_makers
    JOIN model_list
        ON car_makers.model_list = model_list.modelid
    JOIN car_names
        ON car_names.model = model_list.model
    JOIN cars_data
        ON cars_data.makeid = car_names.makeid
WHERE cars_data.year = (SELECT MIN(cars_data.year) FROM cars_data)
ORDER BY cars_data.year ASC
SELECT DISTINCT model FROM model_list WHERE year > 1980
SELECT DISTINCT model FROM car_names WHERE year > 1980

SELECT continents.continent, COUNT(car_makers.country) as cnt
FROM continents
JOIN countries ON continents.continent = countries.continent
JOIN car_makers ON countries.country = car_makers.country
JOIN model_list ON car_makers.maker = model_list.maker
JOIN car_names ON model_list.model = car_names.model
JOIN cars_data ON car_names.makeid = cars_data.makeid
GROUP BY continents.continent
ORDER BY continents.continent

SELECT continents.continent, COUNT(countries.countryid) as count_of_car_makers
FROM countries
    JOIN continents ON countries.continent = continents.contid
    JOIN car_makers ON countries.countryid = car_makers.countryid
GROUP BY continents.continent

SELECT countries.countryname, COUNT(car_makers.country) AS count
FROM car_makers
JOIN countries ON car_makers.country = countries.countryid
GROUP BY countries.countryname
ORDER BY count DESC
SELECT countryname FROM countries WHERE id IN (SELECT countryid FROM car_makers GROUP BY countryid HAVING COUNT(*)=MAX(COUNT(*)))

SELECT car_makers.fullname, COUNT(car_makers.id) FROM car_makers INNER JOIN model_list ON car_makers.id = model_list.car_makers INNER JOIN car_names ON model_list.modelid = car_names.modelid INNER JOIN cars_data ON car_names.makeid = cars_data.makeid GROUP BY car_makers.id

SELECT car_makers.id, car_makers.fullname FROM car_makers
JOIN model_list ON car_makers.id = model_list.maker
JOIN car_names ON model_list.model = car_names.model
JOIN cars_data ON car_names.makeid = cars_data.id
GROUP BY car_makers.id, car_makers.fullname
ORDER BY car_makers.id ASC

FROM cars_data

AND model = 'hornet'

AND year = 1971

SELECT cars_data.id, cars_data.mpg, cars_data.cylinders, cars_data.edispl, cars_data.horsepower, cars_data.weight, cars_data.accelerate, cars_data.year FROM cars_data INNER JOIN car_names ON cars_data.makeid = car_names.makeid INNER JOIN model_list ON car_names.model = model_list.model INNER JOIN car_makers ON model_list.maker = car_makers.id INNER JOIN countries ON car_makers.country = countries.countryid INNER JOIN continents ON countries.continent = continents.contid WHERE car_names.model = 'amc hornet sportabout (sw)' AND car_makers.country = 'usa' AND car_makers.fullname = 'amc' AND car_makers.id = 2
SELECT DISTINCT country FROM countries WHERE countryname = 'France'

SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT car_makers.country)
FROM countries
JOIN car_makers ON countries.countryid = car_makers.country
WHERE countries.continent = 'France'
AND car_makers.country = 'France'

SELECT COUNT(*) AS "car_models" FROM model_list WHERE countryid IN
(SELECT countryid FROM countries WHERE countryname = 'United States')
SELECT COUNT(*) AS car_count FROM car_names WHERE country = 'United States'
SELECT AVG(mpg) FROM cars_data WHERE cylinders = 4
SELECT AVG(mpg) FROM cars_data WHERE cylinders = 4
SELECT MIN(weight) FROM cars_data WHERE cylinders = 8 AND year = 1974
SELECT MIN(weight) FROM cars_data WHERE year = 1974 AND cylinders = 8

SELECT
    cm.fullname AS maker,
    cm.country,
    c.model AS model
FROM
    car_makers cm
        INNER JOIN
    countries c ON cm.country = c.countryid
        INNER JOIN
    model_list ml ON cm.maker = ml.maker
        INNER JOIN
    car_names cn ON ml.model = cn.model
        INNER JOIN
    cars_data cd ON cn.makeid = cd.id
ORDER BY
    maker ASC, model ASC

## Step 2: Write the SQL query to return the results

Now that we have the database schema, we can start writing the SQL query to return the results.

The query should be written in the following format:

select distinct c.countryname, c.countryid from countries c, car_makers cm, model_list ml, car_names cn, cars_data cd where c.countryid=cm.countryid and cm.maker=ml.maker and ml.model=cn.make and cn.make=cd.make and cd.mpg>10 and cd.cylinders=4 and cd.edispl>2000 and cd.horsepower>150 and cd.weight>2500 and cd.accelerate<10 and cd.year>2010

SELECT country.countryname, country.countryid
FROM countries
JOIN car_makers ON car_makers.country = countries.countryid
WHERE car_makers.id IS NOT NULL
GROUP BY country.countryid
HAVING COUNT(country.countryid) > 0
ORDER BY country.countryname ASC

SELECT COUNT(*) AS "Number of cars with horsepower more than 150"
FROM cars_data
WHERE horsepower > 150
SELECT COUNT(*) FROM cars_data WHERE horsepower > 150

SELECT year, AVG(weight) as avg_weight
FROM cars_data
GROUP BY year

SELECT DISTINCT countries.countryname FROM countries
  INNER JOIN continents ON countries.continent = continents.contid
  INNER JOIN car_makers ON countries.countryid = car_makers.countryid
  INNER JOIN model_list ON car_makers.modelid = model_list.modelid
  INNER JOIN car_names ON model_list.modelid = car_names.modelid
  INNER JOIN cars_data ON car_names.makeid = cars_data.makeid
  WHERE continents.continent = 'Europe' AND countries.countryname!= 'Canada'
  GROUP BY countries.countryname
  HAVING COUNT(car_makers.countryid) >= 3
  ORDER BY countries.countryname
SELECT countryname FROM countries WHERE continent = 'Europe' AND countryid IN (SELECT countryid FROM car_makers GROUP BY countryid HAVING COUNT(*) >= 3)
SELECT MAX(horsepower), make FROM cars_data WHERE cylinders = 3

SELECT car_names.makeid, max(cars_data.horsepower) FROM car_names
    JOIN cars_data ON cars_data.model = car_names.model
    JOIN model_list ON car_names.model = model_list.model
    JOIN car_makers ON car_makers.id = model_list.maker
    JOIN countries ON car_makers.country = countries.countryid
    JOIN model_list ON model_list.model = car_names.model
    JOIN car_names ON car_names.makeid = car_names.makeid
    WHERE cylinders = 3
    GROUP BY car_names.makeid
SELECT model FROM cars_data WHERE mpg = (SELECT MAX(mpg) FROM cars_data)

SELECT
  car_names.make AS make,
  car_names.model AS model,
  cars_data.mpg AS mpg
FROM
  car_names
  INNER JOIN cars_data ON car_names.makeid = cars_data.makeid
WHERE
  cars_data.mpg = (
    SELECT
      MAX(cars_data.mpg)
    FROM
      cars_data
  )
ORDER BY
  cars_data.mpg DESC
SELECT AVG(horsepower) FROM cars_data WHERE year < 1980

## 2. Write a SQL query to find the number of cars that are more than 4 cylinders

Given the following database schema:
SELECT COUNT(*) FROM cars_data WHERE cylinders > 4

SELECT COUNT(*) 
FROM cars_data 
WHERE year = 1980
SELECT COUNT(*) FROM cars_data WHERE year = 1980
SELECT COUNT(*) FROM car_names WHERE car_names.makeid IN (SELECT car_makers.makeid FROM car_makers WHERE car_makers.fullname = 'American Motor Company')

SELECT COUNT(modelid) 
FROM car_makers 
JOIN model_list ON car_makers.id = model_list.maker 
JOIN car_names ON model_list.model = car_names.model 
JOIN cars_data ON car_names.makeid = cars_data.id 
WHERE car_makers.fullname = 'American Motor Company'
GROUP BY modelid
ORDER BY modelid ASC

SELECT car_makers.id, car_makers.fullname
FROM car_makers
INNER JOIN model_list ON car_makers.id = model_list.maker
INNER JOIN car_names ON model_list.model = car_names.model
INNER JOIN cars_data ON car_names.makeid = cars_data.id
WHERE cars_data.mpg > 20
GROUP BY car_makers.id
HAVING COUNT(car_makers.id) > 3
ORDER BY car_makers.id ASC
```

### 5.3.3. Write a SQL query to find the total number of passengers for each airline

Given the following database schema:
Database: flight_3
Tables:
  airlines: uid, airline, abbreviation, country
  airports: city, airportcode, airportname, country, countryabbrev
    -> references: flights
  flights: airline, flightno, sourceairport, destairport
    -> references: airports
  passengers: flightno, uid, gender, age
    -> references: flights

Write a SQL query to find the total number of passengers for each airline.
SELECT COUNT(*) FROM flights WHERE sourceairport = 'APG'

SELECT COUNT(*) FROM flights WHERE destairport = 'ATO'
```

SELECT COUNT(*) FROM flights WHERE destairport = "ATO"
```
SELECT COUNT(*) FROM flights WHERE sourceairport IN (SELECT airportcode FROM airports WHERE city = 'Aberdeen') AND airline IN (SELECT uid FROM airlines WHERE abbreviation = 'BA')

SELECT COUNT(*) AS num_flights
FROM flights
WHERE sourceairport = 'ABZ'
  AND destairport = 'ABZ'
The following code generates the query:
SELECT COUNT(*) FROM flights WHERE sourceairport = 'ABZ'
SELECT COUNT(*) FROM flights WHERE sourceairport = 'Aberdeen' AND destairport = 'Ashley'

SELECT COUNT(*) FROM flights WHERE sourceairport = 'ABZ' AND destairport = 'ASH'
```

SELECT COUNT(*) FROM flights WHERE airline = 'JetBlue Airways'
```
SELECT COUNT(*) FROM flights WHERE airline!= 'United States'
SELECT COUNT(*) FROM flights WHERE airline='United Airlines' AND destairport='ASY'
SELECT COUNT(*) AS num_flights FROM flights WHERE airline = "United Airlines" AND destairport = "ASY Airport"

SELECT COUNT(*) AS total_flights, airlines.airline, airports.airportname
  FROM flights
  INNER JOIN airlines ON flights.airline = airlines.uid
  INNER JOIN airports ON flights.sourceairport = airports.airportcode
  WHERE airlines.airline = 'United Airlines' AND airports.airportname = 'AHD'
  GROUP BY airlines.airline, airports.airportname
  ORDER BY total_flights DESC

SELECT COUNT(*) AS num_flights 
FROM flights 
WHERE airline = 'United Airlines' 
AND sourceairport = 'AHD Airport'

SELECT COUNT(flightno) AS 'number of flights'
FROM flights f
JOIN airlines a ON f.airline = a.uid
JOIN airports s ON f.sourceairport = s.airportcode
JOIN airports d ON f.destairport = d.airportcode
WHERE a.airline = 'United' AND s.city = 'Aberdeen'
  AND d.city = 'Aberdeen'
GROUP BY f.flightno
ORDER BY number of flights DESC
SELECT COUNT(flightno) FROM flights WHERE airline = 'United Airlines' AND sourceairport = 'Aberdeen'

SELECT city, count(*) as num_of_flights
FROM airports
WHERE airportcode in (SELECT destairport from flights)
GROUP BY city
ORDER BY num_of_flights DESC
LIMIT 1

SELECT airports.city, COUNT(flights.destairport) AS num_flights
FROM flights
INNER JOIN airports ON flights.sourceairport = airports.airportcode
GROUP BY airports.city
ORDER BY num_flights DESC

SELECT city FROM airports WHERE airportcode IN
    (SELECT sourceairport FROM flights WHERE destairport IN
        (SELECT city FROM airports))

SELECT city FROM airports WHERE airportcode IN (SELECT sourceairport FROM flights GROUP BY sourceairport HAVING COUNT(*) > 1)
Explanation: The query first selects all the airports that are the source of more than one flight, using the GROUP BY clause. Then, it selects the city of each airport in the result, using the IN operator.

## Create a SQL query to find the average salary of all employees who have a salary greater than $50,000

Given the following database schema:
